title: Fix Resume Download CTA to open the intended PDF file

requirements.text: Ensure the Home section “Download Resume” CTA opens the intended resume PDF reliably in the browser. The resume file must be served as a static asset and the click behavior must open the PDF (e.g., in a new tab/window) rather than failing silently.

quotes: yes in resume download this file should open

acceptanceCriteria: A resume PDF exists as a static file in the frontend public assets and is accessible via an absolute path (e.g., /assets/Anuj_Chaudhary_Resume.pdf) in production builds.
Clicking “Download Resume” opens the PDF file in the browser (new tab/window acceptable) without console errors.
The behavior works after deployment on the Internet Computer (not only in local dev).

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything in frontend/src/components/ui (compose instead).
Keep the solution fully static for the resume file (no backend changes and no fetching the PDF through Motoko).
nonGoals: Changing resume content text elsewhere on the site.
Adding authentication or gating access to the resume file.
